alert.note: Alert for Franklin, Eastern Oneida Region; Marsh and Arbon Highlands; Raft River Region; Southern Hills, Albion Mountains (Idaho) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Blizzard Warning issued January 12 at 11:55AM MST until January 12 at 8:00PM MST by NWS Pocatello
info.description: ...BLIZZARD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL 8 PM MST THIS EVENING... ...WINTER STORM WARNING NOW IN EFFECT FROM 8 AM SATURDAY TO 11 AM MST SUNDAY... * WHAT...For the Blizzard Warning, blizzard conditions. Additional snow accumulations of up to 4 inches, except up to 7 inches on ridge tops and elevations above passes. Winds gusting as high as 60 mph. For the Winter Storm Warning, heavy snow expected. Total snow accumulations of 5 to 8 inches, except 6 to 15 inches on ridge tops and elevations above passes. * WHERE...Southern Hills/Albion Mountains, Raft River Region, Marsh and Arbon Highlands, Franklin/Eastern Oneida Region, including but not limited to the cities of Albion, Almo, Malta, Rockland, Holbrook, Inkom, McCammon, Downey, Lava Hot Springs, Malad, Preston, and Thatcher. * WHEN...For the Blizzard Warning, until 8 PM MST this evening. For the Winter Storm Warning, from 8 AM Saturday to 11 AM MST Sunday. * IMPACTS...Travel could be very difficult to impossible. Widespread blowing and drifting snow will significantly reduce visibility. The hazardous conditions will impact the evening commute.
info.instruction: For the Blizzard Warning, travel should be restricted to emergencies only. If you must travel, have a winter survival kit with you. If you get stranded, stay with your vehicle. For the Winter Storm Warning, keep an extra flashlight, food, and water in your vehicle in case of an emergency. The latest road conditions can be obtained by calling 5 1 1 or by visiting 511.idaho.gov.
